activities:
Leadspace will use the personal information it receives to operate and enable its service (the "Service"); to improve and customize user experience with the Service; to send its users Service related updates, notices and announcements; to enforce the its Software Service Agreement; to take any action in any case of dispute, or legal proceeding; to prevent fraud, misappropriation, infringements, identity theft and other illegal activities and misuse of the Service; and to comply with any requests and orders of law enforcement agencies and authorities.

For complete information, see the Leadspace Privacy Notice.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Data processed that is covered by the Safe Harbor Framework is business-oriented contact and user details. The data covered does not include manually processed data.
recoursemech: Cooperation and compliance with the EU Data Protection Authorities' (DPAs) Panel, as well as the Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner of Switzerland
